intro: Enchylaena micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are clustered in terminal umbels. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release seeds. Enchylaena micrantha is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
